page.title: 14Ecology,Salem & District(2)
page.content: There is little evidence of pollution generally, but some accidental fouling of the streams does occur due to overflowing slurry pits, but the local farmers have taken steps to control this in recent years. The district abounds in oak trees, also two Scots pines are growing between Crosswell and Rhydygwydd,and a fine beech by the road below Tirmynnydd. {Bird life}is prolific, buzzards,herons sparrowhawks and barn owls are often seen,and a Marsh Harrier was seen on two occasions this summer. {Public footpaths}- officially in use (few are currently passable without difficulty)- 44/108, 44/109, 44/110, 44/111, 44/112,44/122, 44/123, 44/124, 44/125, 44/126,44/127, 44/128, 44/129, 44/130, 44/131,44/132, 44/133, 44/134, 44/135, 44/136,44/137, 44/138, 44/139, 44/140, 44/174,44/175, 44/176.
